Keywords: Avengers , Defenders , Illuminati , Mystical
Real Name: Dr. Stephen Strange
Special Powers
TARGETING: Hindering
RECRUITER: POWER: Choose a character with the Mystical keyword in your KO area that hasn't been chosen for or generated by a Recruiter effect. If you do, generate a character with the Mystical keyword from your Sideline that has a lower point value than the chosen character. This game, the generated character can't be replaced and your opponent scores them immediately instead of when they're KO'd.
MENTOR IN THE MYSTIC ARTS: FREE: Once per turn for all characters with this trait, choose a friendly character with the Mystical keyword. This turn when the chosen character attacks, after resolutions deal a hit target 1 penetrating damage.

December 17, 2022
tidge
The existence of the Av4e 013 Wong (particularly with his Team Up Card) has further improved my opinion of this dial, especially if committed to playing a Mystical keyword them team. The 40-points of Wong is a bit of investment when there are some NASTY Mystical characters that cost fewer points, yet because THIS Dr. Strange is particularly suited to team up with other Mystical keyword characters I see further theme potential.
May 23, 2022
RockyRaccoon
[QUOTE=DarkTortoise23;12186445]Best character for his FREE effect would probably be uncommon Mary Shazam from WW80: movement and 3 attacks in one turn top dial, which means 3 penetrating damage on top of her standard 7 damage. Have her carry an empower piece like svac steel serpent or iron fist and you can get around 12 damage in before reducers.[/QUOTE] Wendigo can make four attacks plus he’s only 15 points. Doppelganger with the Waldo Arm can also make 4 attacks(or 3 without waldo arms) and when he does he deals one penetrating damage to adjacent opposing characters(although that’s only once per turn). Imo Wendigo and Doppelganger are much better choices, although the former is about to be rotated, but Mary Shazam is still a solid choice. [QUOTE=Klingsauce;12197288]Hey just curious how you're getting 3 attacks on mary's top dial? I'm assuming it's by equipping waldo arms or something?[/QUOTE] WW80028 Mary Shazam has this: "ELECTRIC CHARGE: Charge. When Mary Shazam uses it, this turn she has "FREE: [Improved Targeting Adjacent: This character can make range attacks while adjacent to opposing characters.], make a range attack that deals 1 penetrating damage instead of normal damage." " And she has Flurry on her dial so essentially she can make 3 attacks in one turn.

Best character for his FREE effect would probably be uncommon Mary Shazam from WW80: movement and 3 attacks in one turn top dial, which means 3 penetrating damage on top of her standard 7 damage. Have her carry an empower piece like svac steel serpent or iron fist and you can get around 12 damage in before reducers.
February 28, 2022
RockyRaccoon
This is the only recruiter mechanic figure I’d use. You can use it to spawn Wendigo. Like ok I gave 15 points to the opponent. Big whoop. Plus his second trait makes Wendigo so much more terrifying. You’re hardly ever gonna be attacking with him really since he’s mainly a support figure but man is he a dang good one! But when you do attack with him, he’s got a nice 8 range and a solid 11 attack with EE in case you need to wipe out swarm teams. Plus he can always choose himself for his second trait(although why would you?).
February 17, 2022
rkb9190
This is a great piece for the Mystical keyword. He's highly missing top dial Running Shot, but makes up for it with his special abilities. Giving a friendly character 1 penetrating damage on attacks is amazing. His recruiter is amazing as well; a lot of great options to choose from (Blackheart, Weapon Hex, Gambit etc.) 8/10.
February 17, 2022
tidge
In a different era of the game, I'd be satisfied with this figure/dial/cost: It's a low-cost version of Dr. Strange that top-dial does much of what I'd want from the character... for certain themes. I can't be very excited about this dial because everything that makes it special is tied to the generic Mystical keyword, and for that keyword the 50 points would almost certainly be used on a different Mystical keyword figure (e.g. AFFE Scarlet Witch). This is an ok top-dial for Dr. Strange, and it is a welcome return to Modern Age for a 616 version of the character, but frankly I think the dial design has a lot of flaws. The top-half is fine, but single-target Incapacitate plus 3-damage is an unwanted addition, and late-dial Enhancement is usually hard to capitalize on. I would have dropped the Incapacitate and simply have added IMPROVED TARGETING: characters. Phasing is also bit of a joke, as there is no reason NOT to give a SR like this IMPROVED MOVEMENT (characters, blocking). This feels like a leftover fast forces dial to me. EDIT: I should add that I like that he can use the Mentor trait on himself, and that it can be used to possibly get around STOP clicks.
February 11, 2022
RageFueledKitty
he is really good you can recruit wendigo from xtas while its still in rotation and there is a bunch of other good options for him to bring in excited to play this guy!
